Key Match Events: Shaheen Shah Afridi took 4 for 22 in his four overs.
Najmul Hossain Shanto scored 54 off 48 balls.
Mohammad Haris played a crucial innings of 31 off 18 balls.
Pakistan won by 5 wickets with 11 balls remaining.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan grabbed an unexpected lifeline to make the semi-finals.
Shakib Al Hasan's controversial lbw decision was upheld on DRS.
Bangladesh were 70 for 1 after 10 overs but collapsed to 127 for 8.
The Adelaide pitch wasn't great for strokeplay, with a significant difference in strike rates between pace and slower balls.
Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan put on their first fifty partnership of this T20 World Cup.
Taskin Ahmed overstepped, giving Pakistan a crucial free-hit which Mohammad Haris hit for six.
Pakistan's win ensured Netherlands a great chance of finishing fourth in Group 2, securing their place in the next T20 World Cup.
